data.title: Robinson, William Russell, February 7, 2002, tape 2, side 2
data.text:
Date

February 7, 2002

Identifier

31735073022067-04

Source Identifier

31735073022067

Description

Rep. William Russell Robinson, former political writer for the New Pittsburgh Courier, former Pittsburgh City Council member and Pennsylvania State Representative for the 19th District. Neighborhood improvement loans and spending, and lacking results in majority-Black neighborhoods. Legislation during his city council terms: creating security and opportunities for women and minorities. Working on the Human Rights Commission. Re-entering politics after leaving City Council; re-creating political supports and bonds; then joining the Pennsylvania State Legislature. His experience as a "tenacious" politician in the legislature: fighting against identity theft and eminent domain misuse, fighting for small businesses and non-union workers' rights.

Extent

31:43 minutes

Type

sound recording-nonmusical

Source

State and Local Government Archives Oral History Collection, 1996-2002

Language

eng

Contributor

University of Pittsburgh

Collection

State and Local Government Archives Oral History Collection
